Clark and Lana are even bigger, have to explain what happened to the Kents
111121121111111111222.content:
Although Clark was still a little embarrassed about his new condition, Lana and him decided to attend the school dance on Saturday. Lex was confused about how Lana could have gotten herself into the same predicament as Clark, but he had Lana put through the same treatment(with more privacy and full disclosure this time), and gave her and Clark new clothes for the dance Once they had arrived, they were greeted by Chloe and Lois, who were surprised (but happy) to see them there. Surprisingly, no one at the dance (even Lois!) teased Clark and Lana about their recent weight gain. After they had been dancing for over an hour, Clark's curiosity got the better of him and, after excusing himself for a moment, pulled Chloe aside and asked, "Not that I'm not relieved or anything, but why isn't anyone saying anything about my sudden...well..."

"Yours and Lana's sudden horizontal growth?" She quietly added for him. Clark just nodded.In truth, he hadn't even though about the possibility that someone would make fun of Lana (who had gotten even bigger since last night) for her weight gain. He supposed that was because he still thought of Lana as being beautiful, and would think that even if she got bigger or stayed this way permanently...

"Well, I MIGHT have let it slip that there was another meteor-related problem in our town, which make people suddenly gain weight. You know, just in case your condition didn't wear off by Monday. Word travels fast in a small town! I'm glad you decided to go to the dance after all, Clark, but I was wondering...how did Lana get infected too?" Clark quickly explained the situation to Chloe, who nodded her head in understanding and said," Wow, that was a really brave and thoughtful thing for Lana to do for you. I told you she would understand! Well, a slow dance number is coming on , you might want to go back to your date now!" Clark thanked Chloe, and quickly headed back to where Lana was waiting for him.

Chloe watched the (now) large couple dancing and thought to herself, " I wish it was me dancing with Clark, but I'm happy for him and Lana. They go really well together, and they stick by each other through thick or thin, in this case very THICK. I'm just glad Clark has someone that makes him happy." With that though in mind, Chloe went back to dance with her date for the evening.

By Monday...
111121121111111111222.title: Big couple

1111211211111111112221.content:
(Chapter author's note: I do not know if it is okay with the author of this interactive for me to end this leg of the story so soon, or whether this addition violates the story description. I believe it is fine, but if he or she disagrees and deletes this entry, that will be fine. Just know I have no intent to screw up this story)

By Monday, Clark and Lana were back to their normal sizes, although they could not decide whether that was because of Lex's "treatment" or if the the effects of the yellow rock (which Lex had safely disposed of) were temporary to begin with. Strangely, the effects of the rock wore off faster for Clark than for Lana, even taking into account the amount of time Clark had been infected and Lana had not. Clark supposed it had something to do with him being a Kryptonian. He knew that now that he and Lana were closer, he would have to tell her about his secret pretty soon. In any case, Clark was relieved that they didn't have to tell his parents about the latest meteor rock fiasco, he just hoped they would not find out about it from someone else. Lana was just as happy her aunt Nell had not found out about the situation. However, something was still bothering her...

Two months later...

Clark and Lana's relationship had grown over the last couple months, and Clark had even told her Lana about his alien origins a few weeks ago. Although this shocked Lana, she decided that she liked Clark enough to date him despite their ...differences. To everyone at Smallville High, it looked like everything was perfect for the couple. But, as far as Lana was concerned, there was still something missing.

Although she was happy to be with Clark, and that he had finally told her his secret, she had a secret of her own, and it was tearing her up inside to hide it from Clark. The truth was...she had really enjoyed being fat. Even though it had mostly been water weight, she had liked how it felt to be 350 pounds (at her heaviest). All though she had tried to push such thoughts out of her head, they would not let her go, and she had recently resorted to secret bouts of binge eating to make some of that feeling come back, at least temporarily. To her surprise, being stuffed with her favorite foods felt even better than being stuffed with water, and it tasted better too. However, her new eating habits were starting to show up on her figure, and Lana knew Clark would take notice soon. Therefore, one Saturday, alone with Clark at the top floor of Clark's loft, Lana decided to come clean.

"Clark, did you still like me when I was fat?" Lana had not intended to be so forward, but she decided the direct approach was as good as any other with a subject like this. Clark, not quite getting her drift, replied, "Of course, Lana, I still loved you. Besides, I was even bigger than you at the time, so I don't see why you would want to worry about this." Lana sighed, she would just have to spell things out for Clark, "I know, and I know this is a weird question but, did you still find me...attractive?" Clark was rather perplexed by the question, but he had to admit he had still found Lana attractive at her heaviest, maybe even more so. He replied, "Well, actually yes, I still thought you were sexy." He paused awkwardly, "Why are your asking me this?" Lana looked REALLY nervous now, but decided to just come out with it. "Because, well...I enjoyed being fat, ok?" She decided to finish before Clark could interrupt. "I know it's weird but I really enjoyed being heavy and I have recently started overeating,on purpose, and it feels really good. Clark, I don't know what's come over me, but I really want to be fat again!" By this point, Lana, who just KNEW Clark would reject her now, was in tears. She added, "I mean, is that so wrong? If if I can date an alien...from another planet, couldn't you bring yourself to date a fat girl?"

Clark didn't even have to think about it. Lana was his dream girl, he had loved her since he was five. "Ok."

"What?" Lana didn't understand Clark's reaction, did he think she was joking? Before she could say another word, Clark elaborated. " I love you Lana, and I would be attracted to you at any size. If you think eating and getting fat will make you happy, then you should go with that!"

Lana smiled, "That's...just amazing!" After a few moments of taking the situation in, Lana replied with a grin on her face" Well, I bet you Mom still has plenty of those delicious apple and cherry pies in the fridge, would you mind getting me one?"

Clark returned her smile and replied, "An apple or cherry pie?" Lana, giving him a naughty, seductive look, just replied, "Yes, please!"

With that, Clark dashed of to fetch Lana her two desserts. He still didn't now what the future held, but he was sure of one thing...

BIG changes would soon be in store for Lana Lang!
1111211211111111112221.title: Back to Normal?

choices: Hooray! They've now begun shrinking and continue doing so, along with LOIS !!
Lex's help accidentally made things worse for them, Lois is growing differently
1111211211111111112222.content:
Since their business ended unexpectedly early on Sunday, Jonathan suggested that rather than staying another night at the hotel they leave for Smallville right away. Because she was anxious to return home, Martha volunteered to trade shifts driving. So it was a little before 7 a.m. when they drove up the County lane to their farm.

THAT SUNDAY DOWN ON THE FARM:

After the dance on Saturday night, Clark had suggested to Lana that it would probably be better if she stayed at the farm until she shrunk back to her normal size on Sunday or Monday. He felt that it would be better for both of them. With so many kids seeing them at their new jumbo size, no one would be surprised if they didn't show up for school. Lana readily accepted Clark's offer. After all, she thought, this sure is a different way for me to see a whole LOT more of Clark. Lana came up with a surprisingly large number of things for them to do and talk about while they both grew much bigger on Sunday. Surprisingly, while Lana's appetite seemed to be increasing even faster than her new body's growth, Clark's stayed the same.

Making things even worse for Clark's sanity, nosey Lois showed up bright and early Sunday morning. Being new to Smallville, she still couldn't get over actually SEEING one of Chloe's meteor freak stories in person. Lois had always assumed that Chloe had been exaggerating when she told Lois about all of the strange events in and around Smallville. While Clark was out doing his morning chores, Lois convinced Lana to show her the box containing the yellow rock, which of course Lois just HAD to hold. Although she put some gloves on, just to be safe, Lois dropped it almost immediately due to the intense cold it radiated. So she would soon be affected differently by it than Clark and Lana had been. When she didn't start plumping up with a few minutes Lois totally dismissed their story. Thoroughly stumped Lana then said, "Well Lois, I guess the rock decided that you're already BIG enough." That drew a strange look from Lois and she left the farm. Lana decided to not tell Clark about Lois' visit.

Clark grew increasingly anxious about how quickly his body would return to normal. Later Sunday morning after Lois had left, Clark noticed that Lana for some unknown reason seemed to be really enjoying her still expanding frontier. Surprisingly he hadn't noticed that they were both growing a little taller every time they grew fatter. He thought that every girl's biggest worry was GAINING too much weight, yet it seemed to him that Lana wouldn't be at all unhappy if her body ended up staying at this new size. Which worried him even more every time her body again expanded. By Sunday night, while Lana still had a couple inches clearance entering the house, but Clark now could BARELY squeeze through the front door. So he suggested that they should both sleep out in the barn. "To be on the safe side," he said.

Lana then started laughing SO hard she fell down in the living room. It was almost 10 minutes later before Lana had calmed down enough to tell Clark what was so funny. Wearing a very impish grin, Lana told Clark, "For the past couple of years, I've wanted to get you to roll in the hay with me, Clark and it seems that I only had to gain a couple hundred pounds for you to ask me. Isn't that just delicious?" Clark doesn't see the humor in the situation so he's not at all thrilled about Lana's happiness. While he can still get to the house telephone to double check about things, Clark called Lex. Lex assured him again that both of them WOULD be returning to normal in the next 12 to 18 hours. Since Clark had been affected first, he should shrink back first. Clark thanked Lex for his encouraging news. He then went out to the barn to sleep with Lana.

Of course, he didn't mention THAT to Lex. Mind you, they did sleep in separate horse stalls. Something Lana was perfectly content to do, which was really a relief to Clark. Which was far more than he would EVER admit to Lana. After all, she figured that technically she would be sleeping in the same room (so to speak) with Clark so she was happy with that. Since Clark wanted to get whatever chores done that he could Monday morning, Lana was alone in the barn when the Kent's unexpectedly returned early. When they drove up Martha noticed Lana's car parked by the barn and said to Jonathan, "Well I guess we should have called Clark to tell him we would be coming home early after all." Jonathan asked why and she pointed out Lana's car to him.

Slowly Lana waddled out of the barn, Martha gasped at how big she had ballooned. By then, Lana had already gained nearly 250 pounds, she was now nearly 3 inches taller and Lana was happier than she had ever been in her life. Clark was still out in the fields and he had gained over 300 pounds and 4 inches. Once Martha had recovered from the shock of Lana's new size, Lana told the Kent's about the pretty yellow rock that had caused her sudden growth to start on Friday afternoon. Knowing everything that they knew about Kryptonite they just pretended to be as surprised as they should. Shortly after Lana had finished, Clark returned from his early morning rounds. He wore a very nervous smile and having used his super-hearing to hear everything Lana told them he just nodded, yes.

Considering the size that they had both become, it seemed reasonable that Clark and Lana should stay at the farm until this whole event was over with. The Kent's went inside for some well needed sleep. Everyone figured that by sunset both kids should be back to normal. To be helpful, Lana made breakfast and lunch for everyone. Considering how much food she had eaten that weekend, Lana figured that was only fair. Had she not been so tired, Martha would have more strenuously disagreed with Lana than she did that morning. When the Kent's went outside late that afternoon, had either or both of them finally returned to their normal size AND has anything happened to Lois yet?
1111211211111111112222.title: Too big for the House

choices: After showing Lois to the Sheriff, Chloe takes her out to the Kent farm.
After the Sheriff sees Lois, Chloe takes her out to Lex's Mansion for help.
11112112111111111122221.content:
When Lana and Clark sat down for lunch he shrank, just a little, for the first time. Not wanting to wake his parents, they both quietly cheered the good news. Clark ate his usual lunch but Lana ate over twice her normal amount. Looking at how much food Lana was comfortably putting away at every meal really worried Clark. He was stumped over why the Kryptonite seemed to be having such an extreme effect on only Lana. He was fervently hoping that when she returned back to her normal size, her appetite would follow. Clark would be beside himself, if Lana ended up ANY heavier than before her encounter with the Kryptonite. Clark now deeply regretted that Lana had even SEEN him fat in the first place.

Just before dinner-time the Kent's came downstairs. They had both been bone-tired and really needed the rest. Lana was sitting outside because she had not fit through the front door since shortly after she finished making the meals. By then, Clark had shrunk enough to MAYBE squeeze through but he told Lana that he would wait to go inside. He felt that they should go through the front door together for the first time. Clark was stunned that Lana then wrapped her arms, as much as she could, around Clark giving him the longest, sexiest kiss she could. When she FINALLY came up for air Lana immediately said, "Why, thank you Clark, it'll be just like we've just married and you're carrying me over the threshold." Taken aback by Lana's statement, Clark saw absolutely NOTHING wrong with what she had said.

Seeing the kids still sitting outside, Jonathan asked, "Well, any good news yet?" Lana yelled back in reply, "Clark's shrinking, but I'm still growing bigger Mr. Kent. Considering how much time it was between when we each touched the rock, I should begin shrinking soon." Lana was right. About half an hour later a pop came from inside her and Lana felt the pressure inside lessen ever so slightly. It wasn't apparent to anyone else that Lana was shrinking for another couple of hours. It was late that evening when Lana could again fit through the front door and true to his word Clark very gingerly lifted Lana (he needed to pretend that he could barely pick her up) and then carried her inside. After carefully putting Lana down on her feet, Clark enthusiastically returned the kiss Lana had given him earlier. The look on Martha Kent's face seeing THAT was worth everything they had been through the past 3 days.

Martha then made up the guest bed for Lana. She still didn't fit in her car and it WAS quite late. So for THREE nights in a row, Lana was thrilled to have slept under the same roof as Clark. This great achievement was something she wasn't about to tell Chloe or anyone else. Lana never did and other than the Kent's, the only people to EVER learn about this were SOME of the Legionnaires from the 31st Century. Clark let it slip out when he visited them in the future. Waking up the next morning, Lana and Clark hadn't fully shrunk back but the were now small enough to go to school. Jonathan drove them into town and they sat in the pickups bed. That day between classes they dashed to the nearest restroom to tighten up their clothes whenever they shrunk.

Lana was far more pleased than Clark with all the complements they received that day from their classmates. So although Clark knew how Chloe had smoothed things over for him at the school dance, he just couldn't bring himself to thank Chloe when he saw her at lunch. She was disappointed and hurt by his seemingly snubbing her. His feelings for Lana had grown over the weekend and he felt that they should BOTH thank Chloe for her help. So after the last class bell rang. Clark searched out Lana and together they went to the Torch. Chloe displeasure with Clark melted when they quietly and privately thanked her. Sitting in a chair next to where they stood, Chloe noticed something odd about them and asked, "Say, how much longer do you two think it'll be, before you return to normal? I would swear both of you are now taller than you were." Before Clark can say anything Lana jumps in saying, "I know Chloe, we're both taller than before. Isn't it wonderful. For once these meteor rocks have done something good for someone."

Realizing Chloe's right, Clark now realizes why all day things have seemed out of place. He's still 75 pounds heavier than usual but his clothes are growing more comfortable every hour. Even though Lana has now also shrunk a lot, her appetite hasn't. Clark noticed that at breakfast that morning and very delicately asked Lana about it. Lana wasn't bothered one bit about Clark's question and truthfully answered that she's still as hungry as she was over the weekend. Since her car was still at his farm, Chloe offered to drive both of them out there. It wasn't that tight of a squeeze because by now they both could fit in a normal sized car. Compacts were still out of bounds, so to speak.

During the drive out to the Kent farm, Lana asked Chloe if she had seen Lois at school. Chloe said, "now that you mention it, I haven't seen her since the dance. Why are you asking Lana? Do you think she has gotten herself into something?" Lana replied, "No, not anything off hand. It's just that on Sunday morning, Lois showed up at Clark's and before I knew it, she had talked me into showing her the pretty yellow rock that made Clark and I grow fat." Clark than jumps in, "Oh no Lana, you didn't let her touch it, did you?" Lana then replied, "She did put some gloves on and Lois dropped it immediately after she had picked it up. She didn't start growing fatter like we had right away so she left not believing me. I was just wondering why I hadn't seen her at school today." Chloe then said that she would go looking for Lois when she returned to town.

Since Lois was new to Smallville, Chloe figured that it wouldn't take her long to find Lois. It was just past sunset, when Chloe finally found Lois' car wrecked on a little used road, a couple of miles out of town with a flat tire. Knowing the General had raised Lois pretty much as a tom-boy she couldn't figure out why Lois hadn't fixed the flat herself. She saw Lois' purse lying on the front seat, her clothes in the back but no sign of Lois anywhere near the car. Now worried about what's happened to her cousin, Chloe called the Sheriff's Office from her mobile telling them about the accident. In less than 10 minutes, a Deputy drove up with the County Crime Scene Unit. They were treating this as a possible crime location.

After the Deputy took her statement, Chloe went back to her car. She called Lana (who was still at Clark) and told them about the accident, Chloe the plugged in her IPOD and drove home. Turning it off when she arrives home, Chloe was surprised to hear SQUEAKING coming from the floor of her back seat. Looking to see what it was, Chloe just couldn't keep herself from laughing out loud when she saw Lois sitting there glaring at her naked, all SEVEN inches of her. Chloe then said, "Well Lois, I suppose next time you won't touch something when someone tells you not to." "Ya, Ya, Ya." Lois replied, just as sarcastic as she could. Chloe then locked Lois in her car. An hour later, Chloe returned with a dozen outfits from her Barbie dolls. Tossing them on the back seat, Chloe told Lois, "get dressed, I'm taking you to the Sheriff." Lois unhappily did as she was told.
11112112111111111122221.title: Dissappearing Lois

choices: To late, Lois &/or Lana learn the Kryptonite SHOULDN"T have been touched again.
Lana WELCOMES what happens to her, while Lois fumes over again coming up SHORT.
111121121111111111222211.content:
Just before she drove to the Sheriff's office, Chloe called Lana telling her to stay with Clark until she returned to the farm. Chloe only said, "I've got something to show both of you. It's a surprise, that I think you'll both enjoy seeing." Chloe hung up before Lana could ask her anything about her mysterious item. Even though the Sheriff WAS a woman, Lois was terribly embarrassed when Chloe had shown her Lois. Chloe further compounded Lois' embarrassment when she said, "I found the answer to our little problem outside town." Although she wasn't full-size, seeing Lois was safe the Sheriff called off the search. Lois was grateful that the Sheriff only told the Deputies that Lois was safe and sound sitting in her office. Chloe giggled loudly at that statement. About 2 1/2 hours after finding Lois, Chloe arrived at the Kent farm.

As she drove up the lane, Chloe beeped her horn. Hearing it, the Kent's immediately came outside with Clark and Lana. Except for still being 20 pounds heavier and just a little over 2 inches taller than a few days ago, Clark had returned to his old size. On the other hand, along with still being nearly 2 1/2 inches taller, Lana was still 20(!) dress sizes to big. She also seemed to be shrinking at least twice as slow as Clark. Lana tackled Chloe after she had gotten out of her car. She wanted to again thank Chloe for all of her help at the dance. During the resulting confusion, Chloe dropped her surprise package. Seeing her chance to avoid more embarrassment, Lois first ran under Chloe's car and then towards the open barn door. She had no intention for anyone else to see her in her current REDUCED circumstances.

Now only 6 1/4 inches tall, Lois was grateful that she had chosen to wear a skirt rather than pants. They would've now been dragging on the ground slowing her escape. Lois made it inside before Chloe realized she had escaped. The surprise now spoiled, Chloe told everyone about Lois so they all fanned out looking for her. Lana was the first to notice the really, really small human footprints heading towards the barn. Not bothering to tell the others Lana went inside alone. Locking the door behind her, Lana KNEW that she had trapped Lois in there. She planned to really gloat, when she found her diminished classmate. Remembering where the box with the yellow Kryptonite was stashed, Lois had taken a bee-line there. She had figured that touching it now at her present size would be the only way Lois could return to her normal size. If Lana hadn't found her when she did, things might have worked out alright for Lois.
111121121111111111222211.title: The Incredible shrinking Lois

choices: Except for a still 22-inch waist, Lana soon blossoms into twice the girl she was
Lois unhappily grows proportionally much bigger and VERY differently than Lana.
1111211211111111112222112.content:
After loudly closing the barn door, Lana yelled out to Lois saying, "Alright shorty, where are you?" Not hearing anything from Lois, Lana proceeded over to where the box containing the yellow Kryptonite was stashed. Since had Lois climbed up from underneath, they both arrived at the box at virtually the same time. Now seeing how comical Lois looked, Lana quickly whipped out her camera phone and told Lois, "Say, cheese." The expression on Lois' face that Lana caught on her phone was priceless. Putting her mobile phone back in its pocket, Lana decided to tease Lois some more with the box. Holding it JUST out of the still barely 6-inch tall Lois reach, Lana shook the box a couple of times. She then proceeded to open the box just a little saying, "Something in here you're looking for, Lois?"

Just then, someone momentarily opened the barn door distracting Lana. Lois took advantage of her unexpected opportunity and leaped towards the still open box. Unfortunately for her, Lana noticed the movement out of the corner of her eye so she reached for the box and closed it. Lois succeeded in barely getting one hand inside, thereby making Lana reopen the box to pull it out. While Lois had wanted to touch the stone, Lana didn't. She was already quite happy with what she expected her bodies new size would end up becoming when she finished shrinking. When Lana pulled Lois' hand out of the box the pinkie finger on her right hand brushed up against the stone a couple of times. Lana felt a slight shiver from the contact. She also stopped shrinking while still a size 16. Standing 5' 1" and with a now undersized waist, Lana sported a surprisingly sexy figure. Unhappy with not being able to touch the stone, Lois lets go with a real blue streak of words. So Lana angrily threw Lois into the box saying, "If you're so set on becoming the BIG girl in town Lois, your welcome to it." Lana then closed the box with Lois squirming inside.

Within seconds of that, Lois started pleading with Lana to let her out because now she was freezing in there. After Lois at been in there half a minute, Lana turned the box upside down and unceremoniously dumped Lois out, along with the yellow Kryptonite. In that short period of time inside the box Lois had turned a very dark shade of blue which worried Lana. After she had quickly picked up and returned the stone to its box, Lana took Lois inside Clark's house to get her warmed up. Lana didn't mention to Clark anything about what had happened in the barn. Out of embarrassment, Lois also kept quiet about everything that had happened there. Now small enough to fit comfortably inside her car, Lana drove home to her apartment at the Talon. She had greatly enjoyed spending the weekend with Clark but Lana had really missed not sleeping in her antique 4-poster bed for several days.

The next morning right after they both woke up, Lana and Lois immediately realized that they had both grown bigger overnight. While Lana was now even TALLER than she had been before her shrinking started, not all of Lois' body had grown proportionally bigger and boy was she letting EVERYONE within earshot of the Kent house know it! Rolling out of bed, Lana flopped to the floor from the unexpected extra weight now centered firmly on her chest. It took several minutes of fruitless searching before Lana realized that the only shirt big enough to contain ALL of her chest NOW was one of Clark's XL-size sweat shirts. He had left it there, one day after school when he had walked Lana home. Lois was now WAY out of balance because only her legs grew during the night. She was apoplectic over NOW being just 16 inches tall with nearly a 10-inch in-seam.
1111211211111111112222112.title: Big Lana. Tiny Lois.

choices: Lois is SO happy that FINALLY she has returned to close to her original height.
Clark then says, "Let's horse around, Lana." She becomes very sad and SKITTISH.
11112112111111111122221121.content:
It was over a week later when Lana realized that like Lois, she wasn't growing larger evenly. For some strange reason that really didn't bother Lana at all, while every other part of her body was slowly increasing in all 3 dimensions and now was from 30-40% bigger and longer including her hair, her waist hadn't changed from the 22-inches it had been for nearly 2 years. Something else happened after Lana touched the yellow kryptonite the second time. Five days after the incident when Lana went to bed (absolutely dead-tired and stuffed) her dreams turned to horses. It might have been triggered by several people around town commenting to Lana that since she had started growing bigger she was now eating as much as a horse.

Lana's dreams became increasingly vivid as every night, Lana dreamed about when she used to ride her favorite mare, Sasha. Lana had ridden as often as she could when she was younger and now she started wondering WHY she had stopped doing so, so abruptly. Since it had been a VERY long time since she had gone riding, a couple of weeks after the dreams had started Lana decided to go out on the next Saturday, to the stables where her favorite mare was boarded and spend the whole day with her riding. Lana became so enthusiastic thinking about riding again, Lois found out and started plotting. By the time Saturday morning came a now over 10 foot tall Lana with silky hair almost as long was giddy with anticipation.

By now, absolutely all of Lois's body had grown visibly bigger but her legs were still WAY out of proportion with the rest of her body. Now that Lois was FINALLY over 3 feet tall, she was getting around Smallville without too much difficulty. Still having not learned her lesson about touching the yellow kryptonite and now quite determined to become the BIGGEST reporter in Kansas, Lois convinced Lana to take her with her on Saturday when she drove out to the riding stables. Lois's real reason for tagging along was she would now be fairly close to the Kent farm and she intended to touch that yellow kryptonite AGAIN. Lois' impatience would soon cause her and Lana more trouble that Saturday morning. It had been so long since Lana had gone riding she hadn't known that her favorite mare, Sasha, had had a foal. Her name was Marylou and she had recently been weaned. Since Marylou was about the right height for Lois' current size, Lana teased Lois into riding her. Lois then surprised Lana with just how good a rider she really was.

It did take Lois a while to get used to riding a pony-sized horse. However, she quickly realized that it would be more comfortable for her to ride bareback. Not to be out-done by Lois, Lana then returned to the stable and removed Sasha's saddle. So after spending about half an hour preparing for their ride the 2 high-school girls went out on to the riding paths. Everything went along smoothly until Lois noticed that they were nearing the Kent farm turn-off. Lana stopped for a moment to look at something along the path and Lois saw her chance. Spurring Marylou on, Lois was over halfway to the Kent's barn before Lana realized it and rode off after her. Figuring that it would be easier to get to the box with the yellow kryptonite in it from horseback Lois stayed on Marylou when she arrived at the barn. She had just picked up the box when Lana arrived inside the barn. Staying on Marylou, Lois then escaped out the open barn door with Lana running after her.

Lois then did something she would almost immediately regret doing. She stopped the pony to taunt Lana with the yellow kryptonite. It gave Lana just enough time to get to her and grab for the box. Lois held it up just out of Lana's reach, so Lana quickly mounted Sasha and the 2 girls started frantically wrestling for the box on horseback. After a couple minutes of this tussling the box suddenly flew out of both their grasp soaring over 25 feet up in the air. Opening up when it reached the highest point in its arc, the yellow kryptonite came down to Earth between them and shattered on the gravel pathway. When the yellow kryptonite shattered on the ground there was a blinding flash and accompanying bang that knocked both girls and the horses unconscious.

Shattering, the yellow kryptonite disintegrated into an extremely fine dust that coated both girls bodies along with the mares. Also all four of them inhaled this ultra-fine yellow kryptonite dust very deeply into their lungs. Nearly 10 minutes later after the dust had been completely absorbed by both the girls AND horses bodies, Lana finally woke up. Now standing exactly 6 feet tall, Lois was looking down at Lana. Lois also had a strange look on her face. Spending a few seconds to survey the scene around her, Lana then screamed at the top of her lungs, "Lois, what have you done to us now?" Hearing Lana's voice sounding so loud, different AND very HUSKILY sexy, Clark ran at super-speed from where he was working in the South field. When he came around the still open barn door and saw both girls, Clark smiled very broadly and gave Lana 2 thumbs up. He then said, "Let me guess Lana, this is all Lois' doing, right?" There were enormous tears flowing from her eyes as Lana nodded yes.
11112112111111111122221121.title: Now 6 feet tall, Lois REMAINED smaller than Lana!!

choices: The girls soon learn a Centauress is not the only body the can transform into.
Lois learns to her great dismay, that she's become a still 'growing' Centauress.
111121121111111111222211211.content:
When he turned his attention to Lois, Clark could immediately see that Lois was very happy with her now IMPROVED height of 6 feet even. The silly grin on her face was absolutely nothing compared to her now 3 1/2 foot long, jet-black tail merrily swishing around behind her. Clark asked Lois, "Lois, are you _REALLY_ happy with how you _LOOK_ now?" Lois snapped at Clark saying, "Of course, I do Smallville. No girl in her right mind wouldn't want to have a body just like this." (To emphasize her statement, Lois then pointed at her now gloriously spherical 44E bust) With a very puzzled look on his face Clark then said, "Alright Lois, I won't say anything else, except I thought most girls didn't like to have a big behind like you do now." Now incensed Lois quickly replied, "How dare you go and insult my tight ass like that, Clark. I thought you were more of a gentleman than that. I'm very proud to admit that I spend a lot of time maintaining it's perfect curve, thank you."

Sensing the direction that the conversation was quickly going, the now 12 /2 foot tall Lana very gingerly stood up. Lois and Clark's attention immediately turned to her. With no difficulty at all, Lana then picked Clark up saying, "Clark dear, why don't we go riding before Lois says something, that I'll _make sure_ she'll REGRET having said to us." A little surprised with the ease Lana had lifted him onto her back, Clark was speechless. After all, it's not everyday that your girl friend transforms into an absolutely gorgeous 12 1/2 foot tall Centauress. Just before she gallops off with Clark, Lana said over her shoulder to Lois, "Oh Lois, I totally agree with Clark. I don't think ANY girl who would _EVER_ willingly want a rear-end like yours." More incensed than before, Lois angrily stamped her left foot on the ground. Her newly grown tail then swished right up into her face. Which elicited from Lois, a whole slew of words unsuitable for children OR mixed company. (Until THAT very moment, Lois hadn't even realized that SHE had grown a tail). Lois had assumed that only Lana had transformed into an equine body.

Riding his girl friend like none has ever been RIDDEN before, Clark quietly took in the scenery as Lana trotted off towards the field Clark had come from a few minutes earlier. Arriving at where his equipment was still standing, Lana further surprised Clark saying, "Clark dear, I'm sure that the TWO of us can clear this field before sunset." Stuttering at her statement Clark finally blurts out, "Lana, are you sure about this? Shouldn't we first look for some way to return you to your normal human body? After all, it's just not right that you stay like you are." Lana testily replied "Not on your life Clark, I love my new body. I know that it's a little different, but if we were the same height my new body would be perfect." (being very pragmatic about her current situation) Lana then said, "Oh come on now Clark. Haven't you thought some about us getting married someday and working on the farm together?" Clark now growing concerned about Lana' mental state replied, "Welllll, yes Lana but not like THIS! Several times now, my parents have mentioned how happy they would be having you as a daughter-in-law." Hearing that, Lana very loudly whinnied her approval.

Seeing that Lana was very determined about helping him with his chores, Clark started his work where he left off with Lana happily toiling at his side. Now unable use any of his powers in front of Lana, it WAS about half a hour before sunset when the two teens finished clearing the field. Clark only took 3 steps towards the house before Lana again grabbed him and placed him on her back. When he started to protest the treatment, Lana started crying. Through her tears Lana said, "Clark dear PLEASE let me carry you. For some reason that I can't explain, I feel compelled to do this. It's almost as if my soul would be incomplete if you didn't ride on my back." Seeing the pain Lana was now in Clark agreed saying, "Alright Lana, I'll ride you but JUST for today." As fast as she could, Lana happily galloped back to the Kent farmhouse.

Arriving there, instead of walking towards the house when Clark jumped off her back, Lana walked towards the barn. Seeing the look on his face and before Clark could get a word out Lana said, "Clark let's be practical about this. The barn IS the only building big enough for me to be comfortable in now. I'll stay dry when it rains and after dinner tonight, I'll talk to your mother about getting a few of my things from my apartment." Just before Clark opened the now closed barn door his parents walked out of the house. Seeing Lana in her new form was a bit of a shock, but they got over it fairly quickly. Asking Lana what she wanted for dinner, Martha Kent wasn't too surprised to hear her say, "whatever you cook will be alright with me, Mrs. Kent. Only could we have some apple pie for dessert? For some strange reason, that's the one food that I'm really hungry for now." Martha chuckled saying, "Alright Lana how about if I bake TWO apple pies just for you." Lana whinnied her appreciation to Martha. Both parents looked at Clark with puzzled looks and he said, "Apparently, instead of squealing for joy, Lana now whinnies to show that she's really happy about something."

A little after 9:00 with dinner done and the dishes washed, Martha left to collect the items that Lana had asked for from her apartment, it was time she got ready for bed. The four of them had discussed what to do in the morning without agreeing on anything. At the end of the discussion, Lana did say that she should call Lois about her little problem. Clark really laughed hard about that saying to his parents, "Lana you should explain to my parents about that. I'm going out to the barn now to retrieve a couple of spare horse blankets stored in the loft." When he entered the barn, Clark saw a couple of beady eyes staring at him form one of the horse stalls. It was Lois who had entered earlier to get in from the cold but she didn't say anything. Assuming that it was a barn owl that had flown in Clark ignored it when the eyes quickly disappeared. He spent a few minutes searching for the blankets before he found several of them scattered about in a different place in the loft than he had expected to find them.

Not worrying why they were not where he expected, Clark took the two warmest ones there for Lana. He then left closing and latching the barn door. Approaching Lana who with his parents were standing just inside the front porch, Clark saw the worried look on Lana's face. She had tried calling Lois but she hadn't answered her mobile. Lana was worried about Lois and implored Clark to go looking for her right away. Even though Clark was sure that nothing serious had happened to Lois, after nearly 10 minutes of pleading Clark finally relented and agreed to go looking for her right after Lana had bedded down for the night. He promised to wake her when he found Lois. Returning to the barn and opening the door, Clark saw those eyes again and decided to chase that barn owl out of the barn for Lana's sake.

Grabbing a broom to shoo the owl out Clark was really surprised to here, "Hey, watch it Smallville." Clark then asked, "Lois, what are you doing here hiding in a horse stall ?" "Why do you think, Clark." Lois then walked out into the moonlight, all 6 foot 8 inches of her with a nearly identical body to Lana's. Other than her blue eyes, the main difference between the 2 girls transformations was, in every measurement, Lois was proportionally much smaller than Lana. Triumphantly, Clark returned to the porch saying, "Oh, Lana. You don't have to worry about Lois, I found her." Lana said, "Gee Clark, that was fast. Where did you find her? Is she safe?" Putting his arm around her neck (as best he could) Clark walked with Lana towards the barn saying "Judge for yourself, Lana." When Clark opened the door, Lana literally fell down laughing hysterically when she saw Lois standing there, munching on a couple of carrots. When she finally calmed down the first thing Lana said was, "Clark, you just have to take a picture of the two of us. It'll be the best one yet for Chloe's wall of weird." Clark wasn't successful hiding his own smile when Lana continued on saying, "Alrighty now, since I'm the BIG sister here, I get to choose where I WANT to sleep FIRST". At this point, Lois wasn't about to argue about anything with anybody.
111121121111111111222211211.title: Lois unhappily grows much BIGGER than 6' tall.

choices: When Lois does finish all of her growing, will she end up even BIGGER than Lana?
It's now two years later, which girls life has become more interesting? and WHY?
1111211211111111112222112112.content:
Just after 7 the next morning, Clark was awakened by shouting coming from the barn. Lana had woken up before Lois and being as hungry as a horse (so to speak) she started rummaging through the barn looking for something for breakfast. She whinnied real loud waking Lois when she found a bushel of apples nearly half full. Being ravenous and not knowing or even caring WHY Lana started munching away. Before Lois could even get to where Lana was standing she had already eaten several apples. The fight started when Lois tried to get Lana to slow down and leave some for her. Lana strangely became highly territorial saying, "Lois if your so hungry, go find your own breakfast. These apples are MINE!"

Being so much taller than Lois, Lana thought that would've been the end of it but Lois is a girl who doesn't back down. Even when it would be the prudent thing to do. When Clark entered the barn he immediately realized that he could only separate the girls by using his powers. Which, of course, he did not do. Instead, he said, "Lois why don't you come inside with me, I'm sure I can find nice oatmeal for you." Lois unhappily went with Clark. To get back at Lana, Lois talked Clark into riding HER to school that morning. Lana was so intent on consuming the apples, even though she ran all the way there when she was finally satisfied, she ended up missing first period entirely. If Lex hadn't been so generous in providing Lana with an unlimited supply of apples, her sudden intense craving for them would have quickly caused her to go bankrupt.

It was quite surprising just how fast the whole town adapted to Lana and Lois new equine bodies. Still being short enough to go to school with little difficulty, Lois quickly learned just how advantageous it was to be a Centauress. A couple days after her transformation, a couple of boys made some very CRUDE comments about Lois new body behind her back. Without realizing or seeing that she was doing it, she mule-kicked both boys directly in the family jewels. When she turned around to see what the commotion was all about Lois just grinned saying, "Anybody else want to make a comment?" All the students there and even a couple of teachers standing near her immediately mumbled their acquiescence to her new status.

That afternoon, Lois was EVEN asked to join the girls soccer team. Hearing what had happened in the hall the team's Captain thought that with a little training, Lois could probably accurately kick a soccer ball at least 50 or 60 yards. After all now, she now DID have one whale of a mule-kick. It would've provided a whole new set of strategies for the team. Thanking her for the offer, Lois politely turned her down. Now that she was well over 12 feet tall, Lana had to listen to her class assignments from just outside a classroom window. Which really made things interesting when the weather turned bad. It wasn't long before a private stall was set up for Lana in the gymnasium with a web camera set-up to her classrooms. The next few weeks went by without any new problems for either Centauress.

A couple of months after their transformation into Centauresses, both girls began complaining that their new equine designed clothes were already getting too tight to comfortably wear. A checkup with the tailor found they had both definitely grown bigger. They were very surprised however to learn that they were growing bigger differently. Lois was really pleased to learn that she was growing taller and bigger all around. She started thinking that maybe someday, SHE"LL be the bigger Centauress so Lois THEN planned to put Lana down a peg or two. Which shouldn't have been at all surprising given her body had merged with a young and still growing filly. Lana's increasingly distended belly, which everyone assumed was from eating so apples all the time was only partly the answer. The vet who was checking them out was not that surprised when she gave Lana the good news, "Congratulations Lana, you're pregnant. I know this is quite unexpected, and even better it looks like twins."

Still being a virgin, Lana immediately fainted at the news. Once Lana woke up, Dr. Veronika Johnson explained that obviously Sasha had been pregnant when their bodies had merged. Sasha's owner confirmed that a couple of weeks before the incident, he had tried breeding Sasha and obviously he had succeeded. Lana then started crying about being way to young to be a Mother. Lois started laughing her head off. When Lana snapped at her Lois just said, "Well look at it this way Lana, if Clark decides to marry you now, before too long, he'll have an instant family on his hands." The vet told Lana that she should deliver in about 7 months. Hearing the news of Lana's pregnancy later that afternoon from big mouth Lois, Clark immediately went looking for Lana and DID ask her to marry him.

Lana meekly said, "Yes, tomorrow if at all possible." Lana was worried that if she spent too much time thinking about it, she might back out. That Saturday the strangest wedding that ever happened in Smallville went off with no hitches. Against her better judgment, Lois was the Maiden Horse of Honor. Chloe rode in on her back. It had been a busy day at the Talon for Lana Lang. The Talon had quickly become Smallville's number one after-school hangout spot. Originally designed to be a movie theatre, the Talon had been converted into a popular Coffee shop by Lana, with the help of Lex Luthor.

The Talon was decorated with an Egyptian theme, with ornaments in the form of sphinxes and hieroglyphics painted on the walls and pillars. The gold and yellow, mixed with blue and violet colour of the walls, harmoniously complemented the environment.

While Lana generally enjoyed her job, some days the shop got so busy that she didn't get a moments peace. Today was one of those days.

"Could I get a cappuccino please?" One student asked.

"Latte please!" Another student called.

"Over here!" Someone else shouted from across the counter.

"Yeah...in a minute," Lana said, rushing over to the back of the shop to prepare the orders. She frothed the milk, boiled water, and set the machine to make the required drinks. She glanced back at the front of the shop and was relieved to see that no new customers had arrived, but she suddenly realised that the third person who had spoke was her friend Clark, who was smiling at her across the counter.

Lana smiled back, and finished preparing her orders, which she then took to the front of the store. The customers took their drinks and paid her, as Clark moved to the front of the queue.

"Hey Clark," Lana smiled. "What can I get you?"

"Actually I came by to see you," said Clark, looking a little awkward.

Lana herself suddenly felt a little awkward - her and Clark had an on-again off-again relationship, and while the two of them still had feelings for one another, Lana was never sure if Clark was being honest with her - and could never be in a relationship with someone when there was no trust.

"Something I can help you with?" Lana asked.

"I was just wondering if you might want to do something later..." Clark said.

"Clark," Lana sighed. "We've been through this before...I think it's best we give each other some space for now..."

Clark nodded, and forced a smile. "You're right, of course. I'll see you tomorrow..."

Clark turned and walked out, leaving Lana feeling a little bad about rejecting him, but she didn't really want to be dealing with the mysterious side of Clark right now.
