"Meh...I'll look into the food place," Lois replied casually. "You just know that if I cover that chemical leak story something weird will end up happening...I'll play it safe with the chocolate factory."

Chloe laughed. "All right, I'll print you off some directions..."

Chloe tapped a few keys on her keyboard, and a low pitched buzzing noise indicated that the office's printer had started up, she crossed the room to collect the piece of paper.

"So, fancy tagging along Smallville?" Lois asked Clark. "Maybe they'll give us some free samples."

Clark shook his head. "I think I'll give this one a miss Lois, it doesn't exactly sound like my thing..."

"Oh, and food sounds like my thing?" Lois said, placing her hands on her hips.

Clark looked awkward, as usual. "Well...I didn't mean to uh..."

Lois shook her head, smiling inwardly. "Relax Smallville, I'm just messing with you."

Clark breathed a sigh of relief. "Right...right..."

Chloe hurried back over with the printout in her hand, and passed it to Lois. "There you go," Chloe said. "These directions should get you there okay."

"Should?" Lois raised an eyebrow.

Chloe smiled and shrugged. "Well...I've been wrong before. Anyway, their website says that they'll be making all sorts of new healthy products, energy bars...and all that stuff. They offered someone from the Torch a free tour, so they'll be expecting you."

---

Later that day, after she had sat through her compulsory period at school, Lois headed out to the new food factory on the edge of town. She couldn't help but feel this whole thing would turn out to be pretty boring - and would students really be that interested in new food products? Nevertheless, working for The Torch allowed her to add some extra curricular activities to her application to Metropolis University, which was useful. Plus, Lois had to admit she had really been getting into the world of investigative reporting lately.

Having followed the directions given to her by Chloe, Lois had walked some distance from the Kent Farm to the new factory, which was in a fairly remote area of town. As Lois approached the factory, which was surrounded by a high fence, she noticed how high-tech it all looked - it's sleek metal design and smoke spewing chimneys were at odds with the peaceful, country-side serenity of Smallville.

Lois took in her surroundings for a moment, then made her way to the front gate. A security guard made his way towards her from the other side of the gate.

"Hey," said Lois, greeting the moustached man. "I'm Lois Lane, from the high school paper, here to do a story on the factory."

The guard nodded and unlocked the gate. "Oh yeah, go on through Miss Lane, they're expecting you."

Lois smiled and walked past the guard. "They're expecting you" - that always sounds ominous, Lois thought. She headed along the path and through the main entrance, stepping through a revolving door and into a clean, modern looking reception area. A tall blonde woman with spectacles and a sharp business suit was heading towards her.

"Ah! Miss Lane I presume?" The woman asked, looking down at Lois over her glasses.

"That's me," Lois replied.

"Well, welcome to Smallville foods, I'm Miss Decker, I'll be your guide on your tour around the factory," the woman said.

Lois nodded along. "Smallville food huh? Original..."

Miss Decker frowned. "I beg your pardon?"

"Nothing," Lois said quickly, smiling pleasantly in an attempt to cover up her previous sarcasm. "So, how long is this going to take?"

"Oh, no more than an hour," Miss Decker. "Shall we begin?"

Lois nodded, and exhaled slowly as Miss Decker led her through some large double doors up ahead, and onto what appeared to be the factory floor. Lois could see numerous workers packing food into boxes and taping them up.

"This is where we package the food up," Miss Decker says. "As you can see, we have already received plenty of orders from local businesses, and we expect to do a good trade here."

Lois was starting to get bored already, she had to stop herself from yawning as she and Miss Decker headed through another door. However, the next room proved to be a lot more interesting - they were suddenly walking on a gantry overlooking large vats of different foods, some of which Lois didn't even recognise - but she could smell them, and they smelled delicious.

"This is where we refine out products," Miss Decker explained, gesturing to the large containers beneath them. "We use a special process to make all our food as healthy as possible."

"I heard you produce really healthy stuff here, is that right?" Lois asked, peering absent mindedly over the railing at what appeared to be a large vat of chocolate.

"Oh yes, we do," Miss Decker replied. "But we make a wide range of goods as well, and other things such as cakes, muffins and chocolate bars...we know what you young people want."

Lois forced a smile. "Yeah...seems like it..."

They walked out of the current room and entered another clean looking corridor, this one had various metal doors going along it, and Lois noticed how quiet her guide suddenly became as they walked along here.

"So, what goes on down here?" Lois asked.

"Oh this is where our researchers and food technicians make all our products taste as yummy as possible. But I really can't tell you anymore, as this section is top secret, we wouldn't want anyone stealing our company's secret recipe's now would we?" Miss Decker said, quickening her pace slightly as they headed through another door.

Lois took one last look at the mysterious corridor over her shoulder as they exited the corridor and went into the next room, which was a fairly boring looking packaging printing section. The tour continued for another half an hour, with Miss Decker enlightening Lois as to the many amazing products that Smallville foods made, before they found themselves back at the main reception area.

"Well, I hope you enjoyed the tour," Miss Decker said with a smile. "Did you get enough information for your school's article?"

Lois had to stop herself from yawning. "Oh yeah, more than enough thanks," she said.

Miss Decker nodded in satisfaction. "Well, before you go, I've been asked to give you a free sample of some of the food we make here..."

Miss Decker walked up to the front desk, and pulled a basket that was sitting on it towards her, she then beckoned Lois over. Lois looked into the basket, and saw an energy bar, a chocolate bar and a blueberry muffin, amongst other items...they didn't look too bad.

Some time later, Clark had succeeded in getting all of the food out of Lana's car and into the Kent's kitchen, where it was stacked high in a corner. Martha and Jonathan were staring at the pile with perplexed looks on they're faces. Lois had grown to love Mrs. Kent's cooking during her stay at the farm, and did not wish to offend her by eating a chocolate bar and spoiling her appetite.

Unfortunately for all 3 girls safety, Lois had yet to read the wrapper's warning about consuming any dairy products at or around the same time as any product from Smallville Foods...

Dinner soon began, with both Lana and Chloe sticking around at the insistence of Clark's parents. Although she was a little full from scoffing down the chocolate bars earlier, Lois enjoyed every scrap of food on her plate. Lana and Chloe seemed equally satisfied, and, following a delicious dessert, which was Martha's famous extra-rich home made ice cream made with fresh cream and milk, everyone decided to head off to bed.

"Thanks," said Chloe. "Oh, by the way Lois, I've got a craving for one of those blueberry muffins...do you mind if I..."

"Sure," Lois interjected, knowing where this was going. "The sooner we get rid of all that stuff the better, take as many as you want."

Chloe smiled and gathered up a few of the muffins in her arms.

"You sure you got enough there?" Clark asked, looking at Chloe's full arms.

Chloe smirked. "Well...I don't want to be coming down here waking anyone up in the middle of the night because of a muffin craving now do I?"

Clark and Chloe headed off upstairs as Lana took her food and waved goodbye.

She made an appointment to see her earlier the following evening for her help. She also won 2 state championships while competing against adults while still attending Smallville High. Something no-one else had ever done before!

Since Martha told Lana about the people from Smallville Foods reclaiming all of the remaining samples she wanted to find out what she could about everything she had in her possession. Susi then asked, "Lana, wouldn't it be a whole lot easier for you to just buy some more from the store you bought these from?" After spending 40 minutes thinking about Lana's request, Susi agreed to help her any way she could. Susi then carefully examined every bamboo shoot Lana had brought with her and pronounced most of them as seeming to be alright and she would grow and study them for Lana. To thank Susi Q for her help, Lana invited her out for dinner at an all-you-can eat buffet she past near the Sorority House. They stayed there for 90 minutes while Lana made a serious dent in their offerings. Watching Lana shoveling the food down her throat with both hands, Susi felt several pangs of jealousy. She thought to herself, "Man, I wish I could put it away like Lana does and have such a nice trim waist." Being Slavic among other nationalities, Susi kept a very close watch on her calories least she started ballooooning up like her 6' 2" mother who currently weighed 30 stone (420 pounds).

After returning Susi Q to her Sorority, Lana drove back home to Smallville much happier than when she left that day from school. Tossing several bamboo shoots into her goat cheese omelet every OTHER morning, Lana's supply was almost gone when Susi called Lana telling her to come to Kansas State right away. When Lana saw how tall the plants had grown in just a couple of weeks she exclaimed, "WOW, I didn't know bamboo grew THAT fast." Susi replied, "Lana NO species of bamboo or anything else for that matter grows any wheres near as fast as these samples have. Lana I'm really scared about this. Maybe you shouldn't have been eating them so regularly. Just think if people started growing as fast or even worse what if they grew as tall as these plants seem to imply. We'd soon be over-flowing with real LIVE Giants, and not just the sports kind." Would you want to live in a world like that?

Lana then told Susi, "Susi Q, you're over-reacting. If those bamboo shoots could really make someone gigantic almost over-night with as much as I've eaten the past couple of weeks, I'd guess I should probably be 8 or 9 feet tall by now." Susi then said, "Well Lana, you're a little taller than I am now but when you visited me less than 2 weeks ago, I know you were CLEARLY over half a foot shorter. How do you explain that?" Collecting most of the potted bamboo plants, Lana just waved off Susi's concern saying as she left the suite, "Susi Q, don't worry about it. If nothings happened so far, it's not going to start now." 141111111212121122121.title: The Goddessification of Mistress Lana Lang-Part 9

1411111112122.content:
(Chapter Author's warning: this chapter will end this story arc.)

Clark and Lois were still REALLY enjoying their new arrangement. Best of all, winter vacation had started yesterday, and Chloe was now helping Lois and Clark "cover their tracks" so the Kents wouldn't suspect anything! In fact, Chloe was currently letting them "stay over at my house to help me get ready for the back to school issue", while her dad wasn't home, of course. In reality, Clark and a rotund Lois were making out (and progressing from there) in the Sullivan's guest bedroom while a similarly fattened Chloe watched TV downstairs, with the volume at max so the "couple" upstairs could "express themselves" without being heard. ", They TOTALLY owe me for this one!" Chloe thought. This scene was interrupted by the ringing of the telephone, which had been called five times before. After screaming upstairs for Clark and Lois to quite down, Chloe picked up the phone. It was one of the doctors. "I'm sorry to keep calling you miss Sullivan, but we think we may have had a breakthrough." "You mean like a cure?!" Chloe was excited at the prospect, but fearful that this would mean her cousin would drop her best friend. "Yes, but the situation is more complex then that. You and miss Lane should come back to the lab , I will explain more there." Chloe was puzzled , and was thinking of Clark again. "Can anyone come with us?" "I'm afraid not. This is purely confidential. Only you and miss Lane can come. You'll see why you get here." "Ok, we will be there soon."

After breaking Clark and Lois up and explaining the situation to them, Lois and Chloe endured a tense ride to the lab , Finally, after their arrival, a couple of doctors escorted the two heavyset girls into the building and promptly asked them to split up to be consulted separately by the head physician . Lois wondered why the doctors were being so secretive about finding a cure for their condition. Her nervousness only mounted when she heard Chloe screaming with joy . "Darn, I guess that means they really did find a cure!" Lois thought. Although she hadn't admitted it to herself, Lois had been fearing this day would come for awhile now. Sure she could be "thin, beautiful, and healthy" again , but the recent high school grad knew she would miss her recently picked up lifestyle, And as for Clark...well, she was actually starting to think she would miss having him around as more than just a roommate. After all, there was no way he'd be attracted to Lois at her skinniest. " That doesn't mean I.love him or anything though, right!?" Lois realized with a shock that she did. Over the past few months, she had actually allowed herself to fall for the boy-scout. Not that it mattered. She HAD to take the cure. Otherwise, the General would disown his fat daughter and she would be left broke and unable to attend college again. Finally, after almost an hour spent in a mix of both fear and excitement, the head medical researcher stepped in and greeted Lois with a smile and a perplexing statement."Well, miss Lane, I have some good news, and some more good news!" "Ok, what's the first bit of good news." "We found a cure for your condition." "I figured that part out already." Lois couldn't suppress a sigh after her reply.She knew she would have to go through with it,but Lois would REALLY miss being fat. The doctor noticed Lois's less than upbeat reaction. "I see that this news doesn't excite you as much as your cousin, Is something wrong? This conversation is completely confidential." Lois hesitated, then reluctantly replied, "I've just gotten used to this new lifestyle of being lazy and eating whatever I want. I guess that sounds pretty stupid to you." Not really Miss Lane. In fact, I think the other bit of news may raise your spirits." "What's that?"

The doctor smiled. "There's actually no medical need for you to take the cure. Apparently the formula in the food you ate, in addition to increasing your weight and (temporarily) your appetite, also mutated your cells; allowing them to adjust to any weight, bodily composition, or level of physical activity you could put them though, and still be healthy." "What does that mean?" "May I be blunt, miss Lane?" "Please." " If you don't take the cure, you can be as lazy and gluttonous as you want, and no matter how fat you get, you will never have health or mobility problems, Of course, you will never be skinny again, either." Lois couldn't help but smile, despite her lack of hunger pains the last couple of weeks, the super-sized teen had continued to gorge herself more and more lately, and was very pleased with the idea that she could continue her lifestyle and her relationship with Clark, unabated. Immediately though, a dismal thought hit Lois, and she frowned before asking the doctor a question. "But if I don't take the cure, I don't get the settlement, right? Then I wouldn't be able to afford to go to college. I mean, you work for Smallville Foods, you would have to tell them I refused. right?" The doctor smiled and shook his head. "Not directly, I'm and independent contractor, but as a doctor, my first responsibility is to my patient. You see, with you body currently so adaptable to circumstances, you are probably better off not taking the cure from a purely medical standpoint. That is why we have been so secretive; making sure you and miss Sullivan were alone while telling you about the cure. I've worked with my staff for years; I trust them, and they are sworn to secrecy. Your cousin has already decided to take the cure, but we haven't told anyone YOUR condition is treatable. If you decide not to take the cure, I will just tell your father, and Smallville foods, that your condition, although benign, is untreatable, and that they might as well allow you to just eat what you want and relax. Smallville foods will still have to give you the settlement, since their formula changed your lifestyle so drastically." "Thank you! But...is that legal?" The doctor shrugged, "Allowing a patient to be healthy and make their own life choices is the only ethical thing a doctor can do in this kind of situation. So, do you want the curet?" "Hell no!I mean...no!" Lois looked down sheepishly. She couldn't believe she was making the decision to stay, as the General would probably describe her now, "a lazy pig", but she was clearly happier and less stressed this way! The head doctor must have picked up on her embarrassment, and added, "You don't need to be embarrassed at this decision miss Lane, a lot of people choose, or are forced by genes or habit, to live a fat lifestyle such as your own all the time. Of course, their circumstances have come with more of a health risk than your own, until now, that is." "What do you mean, until now?" "I already have miss Sullivan's permission to use that data we have collected while finding a cure. Medicine may never be able to cure obesity, but with the data from our test, we CAN cure ALL obesity related illnesses! If you give us your permission to use this info, withing ten years time, every fat person in the industrialized world should be perfectly healthy." "So I get to be moderately wealthy, eat whatever I want, take it easy, and I can help millions of people around the world? Of course you can use the data!" "Thank you miss Lane, pretty soon, millions around the world will be thanking you and your cousin too. One last thing, you may find one downside to your new lifestyle. Unfortunately, most men you age don't like larger women, so...". Lois interrupted the doctor with a smile while thinking of Clark, She was definitively ready to take her relationship with him out of just the physical stage, but she knew he would be glad she decided not to take the cure.
